snippet: There is a growing demand for no-longer-ready-for-prime-time celebrities willing to vouch for products in ads often shown during reruns of movies and TV shows they made during their salad days.
abstract: There is a growing demand for aging actors and celebrities willing to vouch for products like reverse mortgages and medications in ads to seniors, reflecting changing demographics in the United States; Americans are living longer, with the average life expectancy reaching 78.7 in 2010; about 10,000 baby boomers are turning 62 each day, and they are being targeted by increasing amounts of advertising from trusted, familiar faces.
lead_paragraph: There is a growing demand for no-longer-ready-for-prime-time celebrities willing to vouch for products in ads often shown during reruns of movies and TV shows they made during their salad days.
